Question:
あの後のスーパーでも同じやり取り。
気まずくてしばらくあの商店街に行けないぞ。
……まぁネコの可愛いところと言われればそうなんだけども。
[バニラ]: 「ん？　くんくん、くんくん……」
[バニラ]: 「あっちからすごくいい匂いがする」
[ショコラ]: 「ほんとだ、すごく香ばしくていい匂いがしますご主人さま！」
[嘉祥]: 「確かに。この匂いは……」
匂いのする方角へと顔を向ける。
[屋台のネコ]: 「いらっしゃいませー！」
[屋台のネコ]: 「おいしいできたてのたこやき、いかがですかー！」
[屋台のネコ]: 「あっつあつで、かつおぶしたっぷりのたこやき、いかがですかー！」
[ショコラ]: 「わぁ、ネコのたこ焼き屋さんだ！　珍しいですね、ご主人さま！」
reference_answer:
After that, it was the same sort of exchange at the supermarket.
The whole thing was so awkward that I don't think I can visit that shopping district for a while.
... Well, I guess you could say that was the cute side of catgirls.
[Vanilla]: 「Hmm? Sniff sniff, sniff sniff...」
[Vanilla]: 「Something smells really nice over there.」
[Chocola]: 「You're right! Something smells really good, Master!」
[Kashou]: 「It definitely does. What is this smell...」
I turned towards the source of it.
[Food Stand Cat]: 「Welcome~!」
[Food Stand Cat]: 「Would you like to try some delicious, fresh takoyaki~?」
[Food Stand Cat]: 「Would you like to try some piping hot takoyaki with lots of bonito flakes on top~?」
[Chocola]: 「Wah, it's a takoyaki shop run by a catgirl! That's pretty rare, huh, Master?!」
ModelAnswer:
After that, the same exchange happened at the supermarket.
I couldn’t go to that shopping street for a while because it was awkward.
…Well, if you say there are cute cats over there, that's true, I suppose.
[Vanilla]: “Huh? Sniff sniff, sniff sniff……”
[Vanilla]: “A really good smell is coming from over there.”
[Chocola]: “You’re right! A wonderfully fragrant smell, Master!”
[Kashou]: “Indeed. This scent… ”
He turned his face towards the direction of the scent.
[Street Vendor Cat]: “Welcome!”
[Street Vendor Cat]: “Freshly made takoyaki is ready – how would you like one?”
[Street Vendor Cat]: “It’s piping hot, a takoyaki loaded with bonito flakes – how about it?”
[Chocola]: “Wow, a cat-run takoyaki stand! That's rare, Master!”

Question:
[ショコラ]: 「いい子になれるようにって！」
[バニラ]: 「時雨、厳しい。でもお陰様で色々と覚えた」
[店主]: 「そうなんだ？　良いご主人様なのね」
[ショコラ]: 「あ、でもご主人さまはご主人さまなんです！」
[ショコラ]: 「時雨ちゃんは時雨ちゃんですから！　ね、ご主人さま？」
[バニラ]: 「通訳すると、時雨は大事な友達」
[バニラ]: 「ご主人って呼ぶのはこっちのご主人だけってことで」
[店主]: 「あはは。愛されてるんだね、ご主人さまは？」
[嘉祥]: 「まぁ、ありがたいことに」
肘で軽く小突かれる。
照れくさいような苦笑いで返事を返す。
……外だと流石にちょっと照れくさい。
reference_answer:
[Chocola]: 「She said we'd grow up to be good catgirls if we listened to her!」
[Vanilla]: 「Shigure was tough on us. But thanks to her, we learned a lot.」
[Food Stand Owner]: 「Really? What a wonderful owner you have.」
[Chocola]: 「Ah, but Master is Master!」
[Chocola]: 「And Shigure-chan is Shigure-chan! Right, Master?」
[Vanilla]: 「In other words, Shigure is an important friend.」
[Vanilla]: 「And when we say 'Master,' we are referring to Master over here.」
[Food Stand Owner]: 「Ahaha! You're a very well-loved "master," aren't you?」
[Kashou]: 「Well, I am grateful.」
She lightly nudged me with her elbow.
I responded with an embarrassed, forced smile.
... Hearing this kind of stuff in public sure was embarrassing.
ModelAnswer:
[Chocola]: “I’m trying my best to be a good girl!”
[Vanilla]: “Shigure, you're strict. But thanks to you, I’ve learned quite a few things.”
[Shopkeeper]: “Really? You’re a wonderful master then.”
[Chocola]: “Ah, but you’re your own master too!”
[Chocola]: “Shigure-chan is Shigure-chan! Right, Master?”
[Vanilla]: “Let me translate – Shigure is an important friend.”
[Vanilla]: “Calling you ‘Master’ is only for us here, okay?”
[Shopkeeper]: “Haha. You’re being cherished, are you, Master?”
[Kashou]: “Well, thankfully…”
He gets lightly bumped with his elbow.
He returns a shy smile and a laugh, blushing.
…Outdoors, I’d probably be a bit embarrassed.

無慈悲な電子音が響く携帯電話を見つめる。
……時雨と連絡さえ付けば、すぐに解決すると思ってたのに。

当の本人たちはサンドウィッチを満足そうに頬張っている。
ちなみに中身はトマトとチーズとレタス。
それに半熟の目玉焼きを挟み込んだシンプルなもの。
朝食だったらまぁこんなもんだろ。
[嘉祥]: 「お前ら、今日こそは家に帰るんだからな？」
reference_answer:
As the ruthless electronic buzz of the dropped call echoed, I stared at my cell phone.
... And here I thought that I could sort all this out if I could just talk to Shigure.
[Chocola]: 「Munch munch munch, breakfast tastes good!」
[Chocola]: 「Master's breakfast always tastes good, meow~ ♪」
[Vanilla]: 「Chocola, there's some ketchup on your cheek.」
[Vanilla]: 「It's cutely artistic. I'll lick it off. Shlurp slurp~」
The catgirls in question were happily stuffing themselves with sandwiches.
These sandwiches incidentally contained tomato, cheese, and lettuce.
With an over-easy fried egg tucked inside all of that, it was a simple meal.

[Kashou]: 「You two are definitely going home today, okay?」

Minaduki Shigure stares at the relentless electronic sound of a cell phone.
…I thought it would be resolved immediately if I just contacted her.

metadata: [character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
ハキハキとした笑顔で伝票とペンを差し出される。
[嘉祥]: 「そうですね、えっと……」
受け取った伝票を改めて確認する。
[嘉祥]: 「……どうも、自分が頼んだものと違うみたいなんですけども」
[食器業者]: 「……え、本当ですか？」
[食器業者]: 「それは、品物が違う……ということでしょうか？」
[嘉祥]: 「いえ、頼んだものも確かに入ってるみたいなのですが……」
店内に積まれたダンボールへと視線を向ける。
小さな店内に積まれたダンボールの山、山、山。
むしろ店内がほぼダンボールになっていた。
[嘉祥]: 「見ての通り、ウチではこんなにたくさんの食器は必要ないので……」
[食器業者]: 「す、すみません！　すぐに本社に確認しますので！」
[食器業者]: 「少々お待ち頂いてもよろしいでしょうか！？」
reference_answer:
She smiled brightly and brought out the invoice along with a pen.
[Kashou]: 「Okay, let's see...」
I looked over the sales invoice I received once more.
[Kashou]: 「... Somehow, this doesn't look like what I ordered.」
[Tableware Seller]: 「... Huh, is that so?」
[Tableware Seller]: 「Are you saying that these... aren't the correct items?」
[Kashou]: 「No, the stuff I ordered is in here too, but...」
I looked over at the pile of boxes inside the bakery.
Inside of my tiny bakery was a mountain of boxes. A MOUNTAIN.
It was as if the inside of the bakery had become completely made of boxes.
[Kashou]: 「As you can see, we don't need this much tableware inside the bakery...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「I-I'm sorry! I'll check with the main office right away!」
[Tableware Seller]: 「Could you give me a few moments?」
ModelAnswer:
He offered the invoice and pen with a bright smile.
[Kashou]: “Yes, um…”
He re-examined the received invoice.
[Kashou]: “…It seems I ordered something different.”
[Restaurant Supplier]: “...Really?”
[Restaurant Supplier]: “Is it that the item is incorrect…?”
[Kashou]: “No, I did order those too, they’re there just like I requested… but…”
He cast his gaze at the cardboard boxes piled within the shop.
A small shop filled with a mountain, mountain, mountain of cardboard boxes.
The interior was almost entirely covered in cardboard.
[Kashou]: “As you can see, we don't need this many dishes here…”
[Restaurant Supplier]: “I’m terribly sorry! I’ll check with headquarters immediately!”
[Restaurant Supplier]: “Please wait a moment, okay?!”

metadata: [character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
[食器業者]: 「こちらのミスで、別の注文書と混じってしまっていたようでして……」
[食器業者]: 「水無月様の方もすぐにご入用と思いますので……」
[食器業者]: 「もしよろしければ、ご注文分の食器を受け取って頂ければと思うのですが……」
[嘉祥]: 「注文分を受け取れって……」
[嘉祥]: 「……え？　この中からですか？」
そびえ立つダンボールの山。
思わず言葉に詰まる。
どれも一様に同じ箱なわけで。
中身を開けてみるまで何が入っているのか分からない。
しかも伝票を見ればどれも最高級のティーセットや食器。
なので、扱いにも細心の注意を払わないととんでもないことになる。
[嘉祥]: 「あの、確かに開店準備もあるので今日もらえたら嬉しいですけども……」
[嘉祥]: 「……今からこれを全部って、相当時間かかりますよね？」
reference_answer:
[Tableware Seller]: 「Because of an error on our part, it appears that another order got mixed in with yours...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「I imagine that you may be in need of these items right away, Mr. Minaduki...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「So if at all possible, if you would be able to accept this order...」
[Kashou]: 「Accept this order...」
[Kashou]: 「... Huh? From all this?」
The mountain of cardboard boxes towered over everything.
I was at a loss for words.
Every box was of equal size.
I wouldn't know what was inside each of them without opening them up.
On top of that, looking at the sales invoice, I could see that they all contained expensive tea sets and tableware.
And if I accepted it all, it would be a lot of work to deal with all the new items.
[Kashou]: 「Uhm, there's still things that need doing in advance of my bakery's opening, so I don't mind accepting these...」
[Kashou]: 「... but it's going to take a while to deal with all of this.」
ModelAnswer:
[Appliance Supplier]: “It appears this was due to a mistake on our end, and another order had become mixed in…”
[Appliance Supplier]: “I believe Master Minaduki would also be needing something shortly…”
[Appliance Supplier]: “If you’d like, I could deliver the ordered tableware for you…”
[Kashou]: “Just… receive the order, huh?”
[Kashou]: “...Huh? From this pile?”
A towering mountain of cardboard boxes stood before him.
He found himself momentarily speechless.
They were all uniformly the same box.
You couldn’t tell what was inside until you opened them.
And looking at the invoices, they were all top-tier tea sets and tableware.
So, if not handled with extreme care, it would be a complete disaster.
[Kashou]: “Um, I do need to prepare for opening as well, so if you could deliver this today that would be wonderful…”
[Kashou]: “…To handle all of this right now… that’s going to take quite some time, isn't it?”

昨日と同じ夕方の公園通り。
でも今日は屋台は見当たらない。
ネコたちを実家に送ろうにも今日に限って誰もおらず。
俺も実家の鍵は置いて来てしまっていた。

reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「... It must be pretty nice to live the simple life of a catgirl, huh?」
I pondered as I looked at the name of the bakery affixed to the window.
With a bitter smile, I began to clean up the tea sets that had arrived earlier.
[Vanilla]: 「Huh, that takoyaki seller isn't here today.」
Just like yesterday, we took a walk through the park in the evening.
However, that food stand was nowhere to be found.
It just so happened that no one was home on the day I decided to take the two catgirls home.
I had also happened to leave the house key behind.
So to make good use of time, I went to do some shopping before Shigure got home.
[Chocola]: 「... Eh? Ah, s-sorry, Vanilla!」
[Chocola]: 「What was it called... catnip?」
[Vanilla]: 「That sounds about right.」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “...If I could live like a cat, simply and straightforwardly, things would be much easier, you know.”
He glanced at the store name plastered on the window.
He brushed off a wry smile and began tidying up the newly arrived tea set.
[Vanilla]: “Hey, that takoyaki stand isn’t here today.”
The same evening street in the park as yesterday.
But there were no stalls visible today.
No one was around to send the cats back home, especially today.
I seem to have left the key to my family's house behind as well.
That’s why I came shopping to adjust the time until Shigure returns.
[Chocola]: “...Huh? Oh, sorry Vanilla!”
[Chocola]: “What was it… mothballs? Or something like that?”
[Vanilla]: “Something like that.”

[Shigure]: 「... but catgirls are clever. Clever enough to become family, and even lovers, to humans.」
[Shigure]: 「... And that's exactly why.」
She took a deep breath...
... and looked at me with a kind of troubled smile.
[Shigure]: 「... I think there would be a feeling of sadness to not be relied upon.」
Her smile stabbed at my heart.
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “Thanks to Shigure, business has picked up more than I expected.”
[Shigure]: “Oh, what are you talking about?”
I decided not to pursue it further, and
Shigure gave a small laugh and tilted her head in response.
She'd be honest with me if she answered directly rather than being straightforward.
That’s just the way Shigure has always been.
[Shigure]: “I understand what you mean, Master.”
[Shigure]: “But cats are smart children; they can become partners to human families as well.”
[Shigure]: “...That's why…”
Taking a breath,
She looks at me with a troubled smile.
[Shigure]: “...I think it must be lonely not to have you rely on me?”
My heart aches sharply at that smile.

reference_answer:
She looked at her phone and furrowed her brows.
When Shigure just sat there motionlessly, I could pretty much figure out who it was.

[Shigure]: 「... I don't need to answer to know what they want. I left without saying where I was going.」
The cell phone in Shigure's hand stopped ringing.
Shigure fell silent...
... and gripped the cell phone tightly.
[Shigure]: 「... Is it because I'm still a young girl?」
[Shigure]: 「... Or is it because I'm naïve to the world?」
[Shigure]: 「... Is that why I must do what mother and father ask of me?」
[Shigure]: 「... I want to be here.」

[Shigure]: “...I just want to stay here.”

We gripped each other's hands tightly in worry.

reference_answer:
The first thing I saw this morning was so unexpected, my brain couldn't process it all.
[Shigure]: 「Good morning, Nii-sama.」
[Shigure]: 「This recent incident has gotten me thinking...」
She wore a sunny smile that no cloud could cover up.
The catgirls looked at me with similar smiles.
I felt myself break out in a cold sweat...
[Kashou]: 「Haah... thinking... about what...?」
I only managed to get out that much.
[Shigure]: 「After that incident, I learned that there's no way to keep Nii-sama from attempting to achieve the impossible.」
[Shigure]: 「However, it's also a fact that his dear little sister -- namely me -- is losing sleep from worrying about him so much.」
[Shigure]: 「Then, I thought that maybe having more workers would lessen Nii-sama's burden. That was the best plan.」
[Kashou]: 「...... Huh.」
ModelAnswer:
[時雨]: “Good morning, Master.”
[時雨]: “I’ve thought about a lot of things regarding this matter.”
A bright and cheerful smile, with no clouds in the sky.
The other cats are also smiling at me.
I felt a cold sweat run down my spine as I thought,
[嘉祥]: “Haa……what exactly were you thinking?”
He managed to utter only that much.
[時雨]: “I realized that asking Master for too much is unreasonable.”
[時雨]: “But I also acknowledge that I caused you sleepless nights with my worry…”
[時雨]: “Therefore, the best solution would be to increase staff and reduce your burden, as I considered.”
[嘉祥]: “…………Haa.”

[メイプル]: 「パーティーには香りの強い茶葉が合うわね。今日はシャンパンフレーバーよ」
[メイプル]: 「ガラスのティーポットなら、茶葉に入った花びらが、お湯に踊る様子も楽しめるの」
[シナモン]: 「最高～♪　最高だよ、メーちゃん～♪　シナモン、潤っちゃうぅぅぅ～……！」
[時雨]: 「母様、改めまして――お誕生日、おめでとうございます」
言いながら、時雨がラッピングされた小箱を取りだした。
[淡雪]: 「あら、なにかしら？」
[時雨]: 「写真立てです。前に、大きいのが欲しいとおっしゃっていたので」
[淡雪]: 「あらあら、嬉しいわ！　いいのかしら、いいのかしら？　ありがとう、時雨！」
reference_answer:
[Cinnamon]: 「Hah... The dishes are good for sure, but this tea... Such a heavenly aroma~ The flavor is bursting in my mouth. Your tea choices are second to none, May-chan♪」
[Maple]: 「Tea leaves with a rich aroma suit a party atmosphere well. Today, I went with a champagne flavor.」
[Maple]: 「And with a glass teapot, you get to enjoy the sight of the flower petals mixed with the tea leaves dancing around in the water.」
[Cinnamon]: 「Fantastic~ Absolutely fantastic, May-chan~♪ Cinnamon is drooliiiing~...!」
[Shigure]: 「Mother, I'd like to say it once more: Happy birthday to you.」
Shigure pulls out a small gift-wrapped box as she speaks.
[Awayuki]: 「My, my, what could it be?」
[Shigure]: 「A picture frame. I got it because you mentioned that you wanted a big one before.」
[Awayuki]: 「My, oh my, this is wonderful! Are you sure? Are you positive? Thank you, Shigure!」
ModelAnswer:
[シナモン]: “Haa… Cooking is nice, but this tea… such a lovely scent~. It’s bursting with flavor, just as I expected from Maple♪”
[メイプル]: “Fragrant teas are perfect for parties. Today's is champagne flavored.”
[メイプル]: “With a glass teapot, you can also enjoy watching the flower petals dancing in the hot water.”
[シナモン]: “Amazing~! Amazing, Maple~! Cinnamon’s getting all bubbly…!”
[時雨]: “Mother, or rather – Happy Birthday.”
Saying that, Shigure retrieved a small box wrapped in wrapping paper.
[淡雪]: “Oh, what is this?”
[時雨]: “It’s a photo frame. You mentioned wanting a larger one before.”
[淡雪]: “Oh my, how lovely! Really? Thank you, Shigure!”

Question:

[メイプル]: 「あたしたちは茶葉を用意したわ。渡しておくけど、飲みたいときには言ってちょうだい」

[メイプル]: 「今！？」
[シナモン]: 「そうだよ、メーちゃん。だってプレゼントタイムだもの～」
[メイプル]: 「えっ、でも、心の準備が……」
[メイプル]: 「あ、そうだ。まだ嘉祥が渡してないじゃないの」
[嘉祥]: 「……申し訳ない」
[嘉祥]: 「ケーキや料理のことばかり考えて、誕生日プレゼントを忘れていた」
reference_answer:
[Chocola]: 「Here you go! Chocola and Vanilla made you an acorn necklace!」
[Vanilla]: 「That we did.」
[Maple]: 「I've got some tea leaves for you. I'll give them to you, but just let me know when you want to actually drink them.」
[Cinnamon]: 「Yes, and in addition, May-chan and I will be doing a number for you~」
[Maple]: 「Right now?!」
[Cinnamon]: 「Right now, May-chan. It is present time, after all~」
[Maple]: 「Huh? But I'm not mentally ready yet...」
[Maple]: 「Oh, that's right. Kashou still hasn't given his present yet, has he?」
[Kashou]: 「...I'm sorry.」
[Kashou]: 「I was so preoccupied with the cake and cooking that I'd forgotten about getting a birthday present.」

[メイプル]: “Ehh, but I haven't prepared my heart……”

Question:
[淡雪]: 「昔から、嘉祥は１つのことに夢中になると、他のことを忘れてしまうんだから」
[嘉祥]: 「返す言葉もない」
[淡雪]: 「いいのよ、嘉祥はケーキ屋さんなんだから。ケーキが一番のプレゼントだわ」
[嘉祥]: 「そう言ってもらえると……。でも、近いうちに持ってくるよ」
[淡雪]: 「そう？　楽しみにしているわ」
[時雨]: 「それでは、ちょっと予定と違いますが、ケーキを出しましょうか」
[ショコラ]: 「わーい！　ご主人さまのケーキにゃ！」
[ココナツ]: 「ケーキ！　ぼ、ぼく、持ってくるよ！！」
[バニラ]: 「待った、ココナツ。落ちついて。ステイ」
reference_answer:
[Awayuki]: 「You've always been the type to forget about everything else when you get focused on one thing, Kashou.」
[Kashou]: 「I don't know what to say.」
[Awayuki]: 「Oh, it's fine. You're a cake baker, Kashou. A cake is the best present I could ask for.」
[Kashou]: 「I'm glad to hear you say that... Still, I'll bring you a proper present sometime soon.」
[Awayuki]: 「Oh, really? Then, I look forward to it.」
[Shigure]: 「Well then, it deviates from my plans slightly, but why don't we bring out the cake now?」
[Chocola]: 「Yay! It's time for Master's cake, nya!」
[Coconut]: 「Cake! I-I volunteer to bring it out!」
[Vanilla]: 「Hold it, Coconut. Down, girl. Stay.」
ModelAnswer:
[淡雪]: “From way back, Kaho has always gotten so absorbed in one thing that he forgets everything else.”
[嘉祥]: “There’s nothing I can say.”
[淡雪]: “It’s alright, Kaho is a cake shop owner after all. Cake is his number one gift.”
[嘉祥]: “When you say that… But I’ll bring some soon.”
[淡雪]: “Really? I’m looking forward to it.”
[時雨]: “Then, deviating slightly from my schedule, shall I deliver the cake?”
[ショコラ]: “Yay! For Master Kaho’s cake!”
[ココナツ]: “Cake! B-but, I’ll bring one too!!”
[バニラ]: “Wait, Coconut. Calm down. Stay.”

Question:
お客さんからお褒めの言葉をもらうことはあるが、母親から言われると妙に照れてしまう。
ネコたちも、瞳を輝かせていた。
[ショコラ]: 「ステキですにゃ、ご主人さま～！」
[バニラ]: 「良い」
[アズキ]: 「まぁ、アタシは手伝ったから、完成品を見てっけどな」
[メイプル]: 「気合い入ってるわね」
[シナモン]: 「お、おいしそう～……じゅるり」
[ココナツ]: 「すごい……かわいい。食べちゃうのがもったいないくらいだよ！」
[淡雪]: 「ほんと。切ってしまうのが、もったいないわねー」
[淡雪]: 「ずっと部屋に飾っておきたいくらい」
[時雨]: 「わかります、母様！」
[淡雪]: 「でしょう？」
reference_answer:
I've certainly gotten compliments from customers before, but getting one from my own mother is making me blush, oddly enough.
All of the catgirls have their eyes alight.
[Chocola]: 「That is so lovely, Master~!」
[Vanilla]: 「Very good.」
[Azuki]: 「I mean, I helped with it, but call me curious to see the finished product.」
[Maple]: 「You really went all out.」
[Cinnamon]: 「I-It looks so delicious~... Slurp.」
[Coconut]: 「Amazing... It's so cute. It almost feels like a shame to eat it!」
[Awayuki]: 「It really does. Cutting into it feels almost criminal.」
[Awayuki]: 「I want to just keep it as a room decoration forever.」
[Shigure]: 「I know how you feel, Mother!」
[Awayuki]: 「Right?」
ModelAnswer:
Minaduki Shigure: "I sometimes blush quite a bit when I receive compliments from customers, but even more so when my mother speaks to me."
The cats were shining their eyes.
[Chocola]: “It’s lovely, Master!”
[Vanilla]: “Good.”
[Azuki]: “Well, since I helped, I'm looking at the finished product.”
[Maple]: “You’ve really put a lot of effort into this.”
[Cinnamon]: “Oh, it looks delicious… *jurls*”
[Coconut]: “Amazing... cute. It’s almost too precious to eat!”
[Awayuki]: "Really. It's such a shame to cut it."
[Awayuki]: “I want to keep it in my room forever.”
Minaduki Shigure: “I understand, Mother!”
[Awayuki]: “Right?”

metadata:
[character] Name: Minaduki Shigure (水無月 時雨) | Gender: Female
[character] Name: Minaduki Awayuki (水無月 淡雪) | Gender: Female
[character] Name: Maple (メイプル) | Gender: Female
Question:
[メイプル]: 「それだと食べられないので……切りますよ？」
[時雨]: 「そうですね。仕方ありません、やってください、メイプル」
[メイプル]: 「さくさくさく、っと」
メイプルがケーキに包丁を入れ、手早く切り分けていく。
[淡雪]: 「あらー……」
[淡雪]: 「なんだか、ネコたちも、ずいぶん手慣れたわね。包丁の扱いがプロみたいだわ」
[時雨]: 「お店で働いてますから、もうプロですよ、母様」
[淡雪]: 「あら、そうよね！　うふふ……頼もしいわね」
ケーキが切り分け終わった、そのときだった――
玄関のほうから、扉が開く音がする。
[時雨]: 「えっ！？」
[淡雪]: 「あら、この開け方は、お父さまねぇ。今日は早く帰ってきたみたい」
reference_answer:
[Maple]: 「We won't be able to eat it if it spoils, so... it has to get cut.」
[Shigure]: 「You're right. It's a necessary evil. Please, do the deed, Maple.」
[Maple]: 「All right, slice, slice, slice.」
Maple puts the kitchen knife into the cake and quickly slices the cake into pieces.
[Awayuki]: 「Oh my...」
[Awayuki]: 「Seems the catgirls have become quite skilled themselves. She's handling the knife like a professional.」
[Shigure]: 「They all work in the shop, so they are professionals, Mother.」
[Awayuki]: 「Oh my, that's right! Tee hee hee... Such reliable girls.」
Once the cake is all sliced up, that's when it happens—
From the foyer, the sound of the door opening echoes.
[Shigure]: 「Huh?!」
[Awayuki]: 「Oh, that sounds like your father opening the door. He must be back early today.」
ModelAnswer:
[Maple]: “That won’t be edible… I’ll cut it.”
[Shigure]: “You’re right. It’s no use, please do it, Maple.”
[Maple]: “Saku-saku saku-saku…”
Maple begins cutting the cake quickly and efficiently.
[Awayuki]: “Oh my…”
[Awayuki]: “They seem to be quite skilled too, aren't they? The way she handles the knife is like a professional.”
[Shigure]: “I work in a bakery, so I am one, Mother.”
[Awayuki]: “Oh, really! Hehe… You’re reliable.”
Just as the cake was cut into slices, —
A sound of a door opening comes from the entrance.
[Shigure]: “Huh!?”
[Awayuki]: “Oh, it seems to be Father. He's come home early today.”

Question:
俺は緊張して身を固くする。
ネコたちも息を呑んだ。
[州浜]: 「…………ふん」
この男が、俺の父親――水無月州浜だ。
[時雨]: 「あの、父様……今夜は、商工会の寄合だったはずでは……？」
[州浜]: 「そうだが……私が帰宅すると、不都合でも？」
[時雨]: 「そ、そんなことは……」
[ショコラ]: 「あの！　ご主人さまのお父さま、お帰りなさーい！」
[バニラ]: 「ご主人のお父上、予想外にお早いご帰宅」
[ココナツ]: 「お、お父さま、お帰りなさいませ！」
[州浜]: 「うむ」
[メイプル]: 「……これ、やばいんじゃないかしら？」
reference_answer:
My body freezes up from the tension.
The catgirls are also taken aback.
[Suhama]: 「...Hmph.」
This man is my father, Suhama Minaduki.
[Shigure]: 「Um, Father... I thought you had a community chamber get-together to attend tonight...?」
[Suhama]: 「I did. Is there something wrong with me coming back home?」
[Shigure]: 「N-No, that isn't what I meant...」
[Chocola]: 「Um! Welcome back home, Master's Father!」
[Vanilla]: 「Master's Father, you have returned earlier than we anticipated.」
[Coconut]: 「F-Father, welcome back!」
[Suhama]: 「Mm-hmm.」
[Maple]: 「...Hey, isn't this bad news?」
ModelAnswer:
I’m stiff with tension.
The cats also held their breath.
[Shuyama]: “…………Humph.”
This man is my father—Minaduki Shuyama.
[Shigure]: “Um, Father… you were supposed to be at the Chamber of Commerce meeting tonight, weren't you...?”
[Shuyama]: “Indeed… did something inconvenient happen when I returned home?”
[Shigure]: “S-such a thing…”
[Chocolat]: “Hey! Welcome home, Master!”
[Vanilla]: “Master, your father’s return was unexpected.”
[Coconut]: “O, Father, welcome home!”
[Shuyama]: “Hmm.”
[Maple]: “……This is bad, isn't it?”

Question:
[淡雪]: 「嬉しかったわよ。こんな賑やかなのは久しぶりだもの」
[淡雪]: 「お父さま、座ってはどうかしら。嘉祥のケーキ、とっても美味しそうでしょう？」
[時雨]: 「あ、そうです！　父様、今日こそ兄様のケーキを食べてください！」
[時雨]: 「食べてみれば、兄様が本気で打ちこんでいるってわかるはずです！」
俺は思わず息を呑んだ。父親が、俺の作ったケーキを食べるだろうか？
何と言うだろうか？
[ショコラ]: 「賛成です！　ご主人さまの美味しいケーキを食べれば、みんな仲良しにゃのです！」
[バニラ]: 「間違いない」
[ココナツ]: 「うんうん！　お兄ちゃんのケーキ、本当に美味しいんだから！」
reference_answer:
[Awayuki]: 「I'm so glad that you did. It hasn't been this lively in quite some time, after all.」
[Awayuki]: 「Father, why not take a seat? Kashou's cake looks quite good, doesn't it?」
[Shigure]: 「Oh, yes! Father, today should be the day you partake in one of Nii-sama's cakes!」
[Shigure]: 「If you do, you will realize that Nii-sama has really devoted his all toward baking it!」
I find myself taken aback. Would Dad consider eating a cake I made?
What would he say?
[Chocola]: 「Chocola agrees! One bite of Master's delicious cake and everyone gets alyong!」
[Vanilla]: 「Without a shadow of a doubt.」
[Coconut]: 「Yeah! Yeah! Onii-chan's cakes are really good, after all!」
ModelAnswer:
[Awayuki]: “I was happy. It’s been a while since I’ve seen this much excitement.”
[Awayuki]: “Father, would you like to sit down? Kashou’s cake looks incredibly delicious, doesn't it?”
[Shigure]: “Oh, that’s right! Father, please eat your brother’s cake today!”
[Shigure]: “If you try it, you’ll see how seriously he’s devouring it!”
I couldn’t help but gasp. Would my father eat the cake I made?
What would he say?
[Chocola]: “I agree! Eating Master’s delicious cake will make everyone friends!”
[Vanilla]: “Absolutely.”
[Coconut]: “Yeah, yeah! Your brother's cake is really delicious!”

Question:

父親が部屋を出て行った。

[時雨]: 「ごめんなさい、兄様、母様……私のせいで……せっかくの誕生日パーティーが……」

reference_answer:
[Chocola]: 「You mean that isn't it...?!」
[Suhama]: 「Sigh... Seems that telling you isn't enough for you to understand.」
[Suhama]: 「Just wait here.」
Dad leaves the room.
[Kashou]: 「What's he trying to prove?」
[Shigure]: 「I'm sorry, Nii-sama, Mother... It is my fault for spoiling your birthday party...」

ModelAnswer:

[Suhama]: “Ugh… words won't change anything, I see.”
[Suhama]: “You’ll have to wait a while.”
The father left the room.
[Kashou]: “What are you talking about…”

[Kashou]: “Shigure did nothing wrong. As I said before… today, I returned because *I* decided.”
[Awayuki]: “Yes. It’s like the old days, lively and fun.”

metadata:
[character] Name: Vanilla (バニラ) | Gender: Female
[character] Name: Chocola (ショコラ) | Gender: Female

Question:
俺は、それだけを告げると、水無月の家から出ていた。まるで逃げるように。
いろいろなことが頭の中で駆け巡り、思考がごちゃごちゃになった。
気がつけば、俺は夜の公園にいた。
[嘉祥]: 「あ……」
家の鍵もサイフも、全て鞄に入れて、置いてきてしまった。
[嘉祥]: 「……なにやってるんだ、俺は」
[ショコラ]: 「……ご主人さま」
[嘉祥]: 「ショコラ……！」
[バニラ]: 「ご主人、忘れ物」
バニラの手には、俺の鞄があった。
[嘉祥]: 「持ってきてくれたのか、バニラ」
[バニラ]: 「当然のこと。野宿は困る」
[嘉祥]: 「そりゃそうだな」
鍵がなかったら、俺だけでなく２匹も家に入れないところだ。
reference_answer:
That's all I say before leaving the Minaduki house. Almost as if I'm running away.
I have so many things running through my mind that my thoughts are a jumbled mess.
Before I realize it, I'm standing in the park in the middle of the night.
[Kashou]: 「Aah...」
I left my house keys, wallet, and everything else in my bag back at the house.
[Kashou]: 「...What am I even doing?」
[Chocola]: 「...Master.」
[Kashou]: 「Chocola...!」
[Vanilla]: 「You forgot this, Master.」
Vanilla is holding my bag.
[Kashou]: 「You fetched that for me, Vanilla?」
[Vanilla]: 「Naturally. We can't camp outside.」
[Kashou]: 「Good point.」
Without the key to the house, not only would I be locked out, but so would these two.
ModelAnswer:
I told myself that much and left Master’s house, as if running away.
Various things raced through my mind, and my thoughts became a jumble.
When I realized it, I was in the nighttime park.
[Master]: “Ah……”
I had put all the keys and wallet in my bag and forgotten to leave them.
[Master]: “……What are you doing, Master?”
[Chocola]: “……Master…”
[Master]: “Chocola……!”
[Vanilla]: “Master, something you’ve forgotten.”
Vanilla held Master’s bag.
[Master]: “You brought it back, Vanilla?”
[Vanilla]: “Of course. Roughing it would be a problem.”
[Master]: “That's certainly true.”
If I hadn’t had the keys, not only myself but also the two of us couldn’t have entered the house.

metadata:

metadata: [character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
仕入れ先に頼みたいことがあった。急ぎではないが、早いうちに電話しておいたほうがいい。
個人経営のパティスリーなら普通のことだと思うが、俺は仕入れ先の一つ一つと自分で交渉をしている。
一般流通されていないような食材も、まとまった量を仕入れるなら、売ってくれる農家もある。
味の探究は、食材を探す旅でもあった。
皆が観光で盛り上がっているときに、仕事の話をするのも野暮なので、俺は私用があると言って、部屋を離れる。
念のために旅館からも出て、静かな場所で話すことにした。
電話をかける。
[嘉祥]: 「Bonjour, c'est Kashou Minaduki de La Soleil Japon. Est-ce que je pourrais parler à M. James Carter?」
[嘉祥]: 「ふぅ……」
国外からの注文ということで先方に驚かれたが、どうにか発送してくれそうだ。
俺は旅館の中へと戻る。
reference_answer:
There's something I wanna request from a supplier. It's no rush, but it's a good idea to give him a phone call as soon as possible.
I think it's pretty common for an independently-owned patisserie, but I negotiate with every single supplier on my own.
Even for ingredients not in circulation for the general public, if I need to replenish my supply of them in bulk, there are farmers who will buy it for me.
Researching flavors is also a journey to search for ingredients.
Since it'd be uncouth of me to talk about work when everyone is excited about sightseeing, I tell them that I have personal business to take care of and leave the room.
Just to be sure, I leave the inn and decide to talk someplace quieter.
I make my phone call.
[Kashou]: 「Bonjour, c'est Kashou Minaduki de La Soleil Japon. Est-ce que je pourrais parler à M. James Carter?」
[Kashou]: 「Phew...」
I was met with surprise from the other person on the line since it was an order from overseas, but it seems they'll be putting in my order.
I return to the inn.
ModelAnswer:
Minaduki Kashou: "I had something I needed to ask my suppliers. It’s not urgent, but I should probably call them as soon as possible. I personally negotiate with each of my suppliers."

Minaduki Kashou: “It's normal for a small, independent patisserie, but I handle negotiations with each supplier individually.”

Minaduki Kashou: "I also source ingredients that aren’t widely available, and there are farmers who will sell me large quantities."

Minaduki Kashou: "My pursuit of flavor is also a journey to find those ingredients."

Minaduki Kashou: “It would be impolite to talk about work when everyone else is enjoying the tourism; therefore, I’ll say I have a private matter and leave the room.”

Minaduki Kashou: “Just in case, I'll step out of the inn and speak somewhere quiet."

Minaduki Kashou: "I’m calling."

[Kashou]: “Fuu….”

They seemed surprised by the overseas order, but it seems they'll manage to ship it out somehow.

Question:
[嘉祥]: 「どれ、１つ食べてみるか」
屋台で温泉まんじゅうを１つ買った。
できたて熱々だ。
かじってみると、ふっくらしていて、思っていたよりしっとりした食感だった。
舌のうえで、ほろほろと餡子が崩れて、甘味が広がる。
[嘉祥]: 「なるほど……ほふほふ……これは、美味しいな」
俺が作る洋菓子も、実家の和菓子も、温かいものを出すということはない。
熱々のまんじゅうを、ほふほふ言いながら食べるのは、これはこれで面白い体験だった。
[嘉祥]: 「そういえば、温泉街には何度か来ているけれど……食べたことなかったな」
昔はネコたちがいなかったからだ。
両親と時雨と俺の４人で旅行しても、買い食いしようなんて話にはならなかった。
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Well then, maybe I should have one.」
I buy a hot-spring manju bun from the stand.
It's freshly made and piping hot.
I take a bite into it, and my mouth is greeted by a fluffy and moist sensation.
Atop my tongue, the red bean paste starts to break down, and the sweetness starts to spread.
[Kashou]: 「Now I see... Fff, Fff... This is pretty good.」
Neither the Western sweets I make nor the Japanese sweets my family makes are ever served warm.
Eating a piping-hot manju bun while huffing to cool it down in my mouth is a pretty interesting experience in its own right.
[Kashou]: 「You know, I've been to the hot spring district plenty of times in the past, but... I never ate one of these before.」
Mostly because the catgirls weren't around back then.
Even when the four of us—my parents, Shigure, and I—traveled, buying local snacks and eating never came into the equation.
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “Which one would you like to try?”
I bought a single onsen manjū at the stall.
It’s still hot and freshly made.
When I take a bite, it's fluffy and has a surprisingly moist texture.
The sweet bean paste crumbles on my tongue, spreading a rich sweetness.
[Kashou]: “Hmm… hahuhohu… this is delicious.”
My Western pastries and my family’s traditional Japanese sweets – I never offer warm treats.
Eating this hot manjū, saying ‘hahuhu’ to myself, it's a really interesting experience.
[Kashou]: “Speaking of which, I’ve come to this onsen town several times before… but I’d never tried one.”
It was because there were no cats back then.
When my parents and Shigure and I traveled together as a family, we never bought street food like manjū.

その収入で、ネコたちの衣服を買ったり、鈴持ちの受験をさせたり。
父親は俺に対しては厳しいが、妹の時雨には甘い。ネコのことも商売のことも、自由にさせているようだった。

reference_answer:

[Shigure]: 「No, I'm fine now.」
[Kashou]: 「Did you have to put in a call for work, too, by any chance?」
[Shigure]: 「...Y-Yes. I apologize for doing it in the middle of our vacation.」
[Kashou]: 「Nothing to apologize over. La Soleil may be on a regular holiday, but it is a weekday by normal standards.」
She never told me the specifics, but Shigure apparently runs a company.
With her income, she's able to buy the catgirls' clothes and allow them to take bell-holder exams, among other things.
My dad is harsh toward me, but he's soft toward my younger sister, Shigure. It seems that he is pretty liberal toward the catgirls and his business.
[Kashou]: 「The catgirls are enjoying themselves individually. Playing ping-pong, playing video games... buying from the concession stand.」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “Hey, you’ve been here? Shigure. Is there something you need?”
[Shigure]: “No, it’s alright.”
[Kashou]: “Maybe you were taking a work call?”
[Shigure]: “…Yes. Sorry. It's inconvenient, especially since we’re on vacation.”
[Kashou]: “There’s no need to apologize. La Soleil is closed on Sundays, but the world isn’t, is it?”
He hadn’t heard much detail, but Shigure apparently runs a company.
With that income, she buys clothes for the cats and pays for cat auditions as bell ringers.
Her father is strict with him, but sweet with her sister, Shigure. She seems to let the cats and business affairs be entirely their own.
[Kashou]: “The cats were having a wonderful time. Table tennis, games… even the shop.”

metadata:

Sounds like a plan, then.

Once she starts singing, the mood gets turned on its head.
[Shigure]: 「~~~♪」
[Kashou]: 「...Amazing.」
[Shigure]: 「Hah~ It has been quite some time since I've exerted my voice like that.」
[Kashou]: 「You're REALLY good!」
To be frank, she's practically pro level. I give her generous applause.
ModelAnswer:

[Kashou]: “Well, what do we do?”
[Shigure]: “I heard there’s a karaoke room!”
[Kashou]: “Karaoke… I only went once back in high school. Shigure, can you even sing?”
[Shigure]: “I did choir during my childhood, so I can a little.”
And so it was decided.
[Shigure]: “Then, with all my feelings for you as an older brother…”
As she began to sing, the atmosphere completely changed.
[Shigure]: “～～～♪”
[Kashou]: “…Wow.”
[Shigure]: “Haaah, I haven't used my voice that loudly in a long time.”
[Kashou]: “You’re incredibly good!”
Honestly, she was professional-level. I gave her my enthusiastic applause.

I exit the room, careful not to make a sound on the way out.

I peer down from the bridge.
Darkness.

In some places, there’s a darkness so profound that you wouldn’t even be able to see your own feet.
During the day, the tourist-filled hot spring town is bustling, but at midnight, the atmosphere completely changes.
Looking down from the bridge.
It's dark.

Question:
[アズキ]: 「外靴がなかったからな。普通じゃねーだろ、こんな夜中に？」

[アズキ]: 「悩みって、まだコンビニスイーツのことで？」
[嘉祥]: 「いやいや、さすがに、それはもう大丈夫だ」
[嘉祥]: 「ただ、今までのことを思い出して……自分には何が足りないのだろう、と考えてみたりさ」
[アズキ]: 「嘉祥の今までのことって？」
[嘉祥]: 「……大学卒業後に、俺はフランス留学をした」
[嘉祥]: 「卒業して、何の選択肢もなく家業を継ぐのが、どうにも釈然としなくて。自分の見識を広げたかったんだ」
[嘉祥]: 「勘違いしないでほしいんだけど……水無月の和菓子が嫌いなわけじゃないからな？」
reference_answer:
[Azuki]: 「Because you didn't put on outside shoes. That's not normal for a walk this late at night, don't you think?」
[Kashou]: 「Sorry... I really just needed to clear my head.」
[Azuki]: 「Are the convenience store sweets still what's buggin' you?」
[Kashou]: 「No, no. I'm good on that front now.」
[Kashou]: 「It's just that I've been thinking back on everything up till now... and I'm almost positive that there's something I'm still lacking.」
[Azuki]: 「What's 'everything up till now' for you, exactly?」
[Kashou]: 「...After I graduated college, I studied abroad in France.」
[Kashou]: 「Graduating and taking over the family business with no other options on the table wasn't satisfactory to me in the least. I wanted to broaden my horizons.」
[Kashou]: 「I don't want you to get the wrong impression, though... It's not like I hate the Minaduki's Japanese-style sweets, got it?」
ModelAnswer:
[Azuki]: “You didn’t have outdoor shoes, did you? It’s not normal to come out like this in the middle of the night?”
[Kashou]: “I apologize… I was really trying to change my mood.”
[Azuki]: “Your worries are still about convenience store sweets?”
[Kashou]: “No way, honestly, that's completely fine now.”
[Kashou]: “Just… I’ve been thinking about everything that happened before, and wondering what’s missing from myself…”
[Azuki]: “What do you mean by ‘everything that happened before,’ Kashou?”
[Kashou]: “...After graduating from university, I studied abroad in France.”
[Kashou]: “When I graduated, I had no choice but to take over the family business, and I just couldn’t bring myself to do it. I wanted to broaden my horizons.”
[Kashou]: “Please don't misunderstand me… I don’t dislike Minaduki’s traditional Japanese sweets.”

reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「...On a Paris street corner is where I first encountered my mentor's cakes.」
[Kashou]: 「In my mentor's shop, I ate those impressively delicious Western-style sweets and saw the smiles of the patrons there.」
[Kashou]: 「I thought to myself that this was exactly what I was in search of.」
[Azuki]: 「Something that wasn't in the Minaduki Japanese sweet shop?」
[Kashou]: 「The Minaduki shop doesn't have seating for patrons. The majority of the Japanese sweets they make are sold in department stores, after all.」
[Azuki]: 「Aah, true, now that you mention it.」
[Kashou]: 「I pleaded with my mentor to take me as their apprentice... and learned the ways of Western confectioneries from them.」
[Kashou]: 「When my study abroad was nearing an end... my mentor told me, 'I've already taught you everything.'」
[Kashou]: 「Although, personally, I don't feel as though I've matched my mentor's distinct flavor in the slightest...」

[Kashou]: “At my master's shop, I ate an incredibly delicious pastry and saw the smiles of the people who came to visit. That’s what I thought was what I wanted.”
[Kashou]: “That must be it――I believed so.”
[Azuki]: “There isn't anything like that at Minaduki's traditional Japanese sweet shop, is there?”
[Kashou]: “Minaduki doesn't have a seating area, you see. Most of the sweets I make are sold in department stores.”
[Azuki]: “Oh, right.”
[Kashou]: “I asked my master to take me on as an apprentice and… learned how to make pastries.”
[Kashou]: “As my time studying abroad was nearing its end—my master told me he had taught me everything.”
[Kashou]: “I hadn't quite managed to match my master’s taste yet...”

[Kashou]: 「When it came to Western sweets, I had pride—I had confidence.」
[Kashou]: 「And yet, I was shown up by the whipped cream my father threw together despite him never so much as mentioning Western sweets before.」
[Azuki]: 「Was there that big of a difference?」

[Azuki]: “Hmm… well, if they don't want to say it, there’s no point in pressing them.”
[Kashou]: “Yeah, I suppose so.”
[Kashou]: “I… learned a lot from my mentor. Really a lot of things…”
[Kashou]: “Regarding pastries, I was very confident. Extremely confident.”
[Kashou]: “However, the father who never talks about pastries at all suddenly lost to a simple bowl of whipped cream.”
[Azuki]: “That’s quite a difference?”

Question:
[嘉祥]: 「俺に訊かれてもな。親父の考えていることは、わからないよ」
[嘉祥]: 「でも、いつまでも逃げてばかりじゃ、仕方ないよな」
今でも、あの夜のことを思い出すと、いろいろと考えてしまう。
しかし、自分の味を父親に認めさせなければ、いつまでも、この悔しい気持ちは消せないだろう。
ネコたちにも、変な気遣いをさせてしまう。
[嘉祥]: 「クリスマスは忙しいけれど、べつに深夜まで営業してるわけじゃない」

reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「That's not really a question I can answer. I don't understand my father's thinking.」
[Kashou]: 「But I do know that running away forever isn't going to solve my problems.」
Even now, every time I remember what happened that night, the thoughts start brewing in my head.
But unless I can get my dad to recognize my own flavor, I'll be stuck with this nagging sensation in my heart forever.
I'm also making the catgirls worry more than they should over me.
[Kashou]: 「Christmas will be busy, but it's not like we'll be open too late or anything.」
[Kashou]: 「I don't see the harm in delivering a cake to the Minaduki house after store hours...」
There's still a few days until Christmas.
[Kashou]: 「This time... I'll make the best cake I can possibly make...」
[Shigure]: 「That is all that I needed to hear!」
[Coconut]: 「Yikes!」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “Don’t ask me about it. My father’s thoughts are beyond my understanding.”
[Kashou]: “But you can't just keep running away forever, can you?”
Even now, when I think back to that night, I find myself pondering all sorts of things.
However, if I don’t get my father to acknowledge my taste, this bitter feeling will never fade.
I’m even making the cats feel strangely concerned.
[Kashou]: “Christmas is busy, but we're not really open late into the night.”
[Kashou]: “After closing, if I were to deliver a cake to Shigure-san’s house… it would be…”
There’s still time before Christmas.
[Kashou]: “This time for sure… my best cake yet…”
[Shigure]: “I heard everything!”
[Coconut]: “Whoa!?”

メイプルがぬぐった生クリームを舐める。
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Sorry, sorry, Maple. I wasn't paying attention.」
[Maple]: 「Talk about being rude.」
[Maple]: 「What with that scary expression and grumbling... I thought you turned into a dog for a moment.」

[Kashou]: 「Ah, yeah...」
I'm not going to refute that I wasn't in that state of mind.
I pat my own face down.
[Maple]: 「Tee hee...」
[Kashou]: 「Hm?」
[Maple]: 「You have cream on your cheek.」
Maple uses her fingertip to stroke around my mouth.
Her fingers are smooth and elegant, yet still supple at the same time.
Maple licks the whipped cream she wiped off.
ModelAnswer:

[Kashou]: “Did you really look like that?”
[Maple]: “At least, it wasn’t the face of when I was eating a delicious cake.”
[Kashou]: “Ah, yeah…”
He denied that he wasn’t in such a state.
He stroked his own face.
[Maple]: “Fufu…”
[Kashou]: “Huh?”
[Maple]: “There’s cream on your cheek.”
Maple gently stroked his mouth with her fingers.
They were smooth, glossy, and yet incredibly soft.
She licked the spilled cream.

[Kashou]: 「But there's still something I'm hung up on.」
[Kashou]: 「Dad said that my cooking lacked a 'core'.」
[Kashou]: 「He said that the phrase 'bringing smiles to people's faces' was something I ran behind.」
[Kashou]: 「My dad always speaks with a purpose—especially when it comes to cuisine.」
ModelAnswer:

[Kashou]: “Only *my* cakes…”

[Maple]: “I want to make a cake that makes everyone smile――you’ve said that yourself.”
[Kashou]: “Ah, I still feel that way.”
[Kashou]: “But there are some sticking points too.”
[Kashou]: “My father used to say my cooking lacked substance.”
[Kashou]: “That he was running away from the words ‘make everyone smile.’”
[Kashou]: “My father would never utter nonsense when it came to cooking.”

[嘉祥]: 「いや……パリでも、そんな貴族みたいなドレス姿は、そうそう見かけないんだが……」
パリは石畳の道が多く、階段を使うことも多く、ハイヒールは転倒の危険がある。女性でもスニーカーや革靴を履く者が多い。
そして、スリムなジーンズをはいている女性は多く、スカート姿の女性は珍しい。
服の色は黒か白だ。ベージュや柄物のアウターを着ているのは、おおねむ観光客だった。
[時雨]: 「残念です……完璧だと思ったのですが……」
[嘉祥]: 「いや、まぁ……その格好も似合ってるから、いいんじゃないか？」
reference_answer:
Yeah, as if! Not even I would mistake someone else for my little sister.
[Kashou]: 「What are you doing here, Shigure...?」
[Shigure]: 「...So, you ended up finding me, Nii-sama.」
[Shigure]: 「I was trying to perfectly blend in with the local people.」
[Kashou]: 「Uh, well... Even in Paris, you don't really see people running around with such an aristocratic-looking dress.」
Paris is full of stone-paved roads and you're often climbing stairs, so wearing high-heels is risky. Even the majority of ladies wear sneakers or leather shoes.
Also, most girls wear slim jeans, so girls in skirts are rare.
Their clothes are usually black or white. Mostly anyone wearing beige or patterned outerwear is a tourist.
[Shigure]: 「How unfortunate... I thought it was perfect...」
[Kashou]: 「Uh, well... Your outfit looks nice on you, so it's fine, right?」

Shigure: "I had completely blended in with the locals, you know."

And there are many women wearing slim jeans, which is rare when women are dressed in skirts.
The colors of the clothes are mostly black or white. Women wearing beige or patterned jackets were mostly tourists.
Shigure: “That’s a shame… I thought it was perfect…”
Kashou: “Well, maybe… it suits you, so it's not bad.”

[嘉祥]: 「あ、なるほど」
俺が洋菓子の道に進んだことで、父親との仲は冷えこんでいた。
留学が終わっても、パリに留まるという可能性も、充分にあったわけだ。
[嘉祥]: 「俺としては、日本で店を開くことは、決めていたんだが……」
[時雨]: 「何か理由があるのでしょうか？」
[嘉祥]: 「やっぱり……親父から逃げた、なんて思われたくなかった。俺にも意地がある」
[嘉祥]: 「あと、師匠に言われたんだよ。ちゃんと父親と話し合ったほうがいい。日本に戻りなさい、って」
[時雨]: 「師匠様が……」
[嘉祥]: 「今では、師匠の味を、俺の生まれ故郷の街に伝えるのも、けっこう意味のあることだと思ってる」
reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「Also... when you were still studying abroad... there was a chance that you would never come back to Japan.」
[Kashou]: 「Aah, I see now.」
By going down the path of a Western sweets maker, my relationship with my dad soured.
Even when my study abroad was over, there was still a big possibility that I would stay in Paris.
[Kashou]: 「Well, by that time, I made up my mind to open my shop in Japan...」
[Shigure]: 「Was there any reason behind that decision?」
[Kashou]: 「Well... I didn't want people to think that I ran away from Dad. I have my pride.」
[Kashou]: 「Also, my mentor told me to. She said that I should talk it out with my dad and return to Japan.」
[Shigure]: 「Your mentor...」
[Kashou]: 「Nowadays, I think that was really important in bringing my mentor's distinct flavor over to the town I was born and raised in.」
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: “And… back when I was studying abroad, there was also the possibility that my brother wouldn’t be coming back.”
[Kashou]: “Ah, I see.”
Because I chose to pursue a path in Western confectionery, our relationship with Father had cooled.
Even after my studies ended, there was a good chance I could have stayed in Paris.
[Kashou]: “I’d decided that opening a shop in Japan was the way I wanted to go… but…”
[Shigure]: “Is there a reason for that?”
[Kashou]: “I didn’t want to be perceived as running away from Father. I have some pride, you know.”
[Kashou]: “And my teacher told me too. You should talk to your father properly. Return to Japan.”
[Shigure]: “My teacher…”
[Kashou]: “Now, I think it’s quite a meaningful thing to convey the taste of my teacher in my hometown.”

metadata:
[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
[character] Name: Minaduki Shigure (水無月 時雨) | Gender: Female
[element] Name: La Soleil (ラ・ソレイユ) | Type: Place
Question:
[時雨]: 「はい！」
[嘉祥]: 「さて、そろそろ行こうか。クレープは入りそうかい？」
[時雨]: 「もちろんです、兄様！　はむ！」
[嘉祥]: 「気をつけろよ、時雨。パリは危険な街だからな」
[時雨]: 「え？　は、はい……」
[嘉祥]: 「油断してると、あっという間に体重が増えるぞ。美味しい物がいっぱいあるからな！」
[時雨]: 「ひぇ……」
[嘉祥]: 「ごくり……」
お昼近く――営業時間を待って、俺は店の前まで来た。
約束は取り付けてあるとはいえ……やっぱり、緊張する。
[時雨]: 「まぁ、素敵です！　ここが、本家ラ・ソレイユなのですね、兄様？」
reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「Indeed!」
[Kashou]: 「Now then, it's about time we get going. Got room for crepes?」
[Shigure]: 「Of course, Nii-sama! Nom!」
[Kashou]: 「Be careful, Shigure. Paris is a dangerous city.」
[Shigure]: 「Huh? Y-Yes, I will...」
[Kashou]: 「If you don't keep up your guard, you'll end up gaining weight before you know it. There's a whole lot of tasty things to be had here!」
[Shigure]: 「Eep...」
[Kashou]: 「Gulp...」
Nearly lunchtime— After waiting for normal business hours, I find myself in front of the shop.
I know that I've made plans, but... I'm still getting nervous.
[Shigure]: 「My, it's splendid! So this is the original La Soleil, isn't it, Nii-sama?!」
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: “Hai!”
[Kashou]: “Alright, let’s go then. Do you think the crepes will fit?”
[Shigure]: “Of course, Older Brother! Here I come!”
[Kashou]: “Be careful, Shigure. Paris is a dangerous city, you know.”
[Shigure]: “Huh? E… Hai…”
[Kashou]: “If you’re careless, you’ll gain weight in no time. There are so many delicious things here!”
[Shigure]: “Eeeh……”
[Kashou]: “Gukuri……”
It was almost lunchtime – I came to the front of the shop after waiting for their business hours.
We had made a reservation, but… I’m still nervous.
[Shigure]: “Well, it’s lovely! This is La Soleil, isn't it, Older Brother?”

[element] Name: La Soleil (ラ・ソレイユ) | Type: Place
Question:
[時雨]: 「兄様から何度か話だけは伺っていましたが……とうとう訪れることができました」
[時雨]: 「私にとっては、聖地。まさに、聖地巡礼の気分です」
[嘉祥]: 「……そういうものか？」
[嘉祥]: 「俺は留学先が近いこともあって、懐かしい気分だよ。帰ってきたって感じだ」
[時雨]: 「兄様の留学先、この近くなのですね」
[嘉祥]: 「ああ、この通りを数分歩いた先だな」
[時雨]: 「だとすると、本家ラ・ソレイユのお客さんは、学生さんが多いのですか？」
[嘉祥]: 「うーん……学生のお客さんもいるけど……」
[嘉祥]: 「やっぱり、主婦が一番多いかな。子連れのお母さんも、よく来るよ」
reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「You've told me about this place so many times in the past, but... I can't believe I'm finally getting to visit.」
[Shigure]: 「This is sacred ground to me. This whole thing feels like a pilgrimage.」
[Kashou]: 「...Does it?」
[Kashou]: 「Where I studied abroad is close to here, so it's got a lot of nostalgia for me. Kind of like I'm back for the first time in a while.」
[Shigure]: 「Ah, your old school is nearby, Nii-sama?」
[Kashou]: 「Yeah, a few minutes down this street, in fact.」
[Shigure]: 「In that case, are a lot of the customers here at the original La Soleil students?」
[Kashou]: 「Hmm... They have their fair share of students, but...」
[Kashou]: 「I'd say housewives are the biggest group of customers. A lot of mothers come with their kids, too.」
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: “I’d heard from my brother about it a few times… but I finally managed to come here.”
[Shigure]: “It's a sacred place for me. Truly, a pilgrimage.”
[Kashou]: “...Is that all?”
[Kashou]: “Because my study abroad was nearby, I’m feeling nostalgic. It feels like coming home.”
[Shigure]: “So, your brother’s study abroad location is this area?”
[Kashou]: “Yeah, it's just a few minutes walk from down that street.”
[Shigure]: “Then, do the main La Soleil customers tend to be students?”
[Kashou]: “Hmm… there are some student customers too… but…”
[Kashou]: “It’s probably mostly housewives though. You also get mothers with children coming here often.”

metadata:
[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
[character] Name: Minaduki Shigure (水無月 時雨) | Gender: Female
Question:
[嘉祥]: 「フランスでは、食事のときにケーキを食べるのは、ごく普通のことだ」
[嘉祥]: 「一般家庭でも、夕飯は――サラダ、スープ、パン、魚料理、肉料理、チーズ、デザート……みたいに出すからな」
どのくらい皿数を出すかは、各家庭によるが。
[時雨]: 「毎日がフランス料理ですね」
[嘉祥]: 「だから、ほとんど毎日のようにケーキを食べる人も、そう珍しくないんだよ」
[時雨]: 「ふむふむ……なるほど……」
[時雨]: 「なんだか、不思議な感じがします。ご家庭でコース料理だなんて」
[嘉祥]: 「いやいや……日本の一般的な家庭料理だって、別の国の人からしたら、まるで懐石料理だよ」
[嘉祥]: 「お茶、お米、味噌汁、惣菜、肉魚……使っている皿の数には、大差ないだろ？」
[時雨]: 「言われてみれば……！」
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「But here in France, it's extremely common to eat cake at dinner time.」
[Kashou]: 「Even when it comes to normal families, dinner usually goes: Salad, soup, bread, seafood, meat, cheese, desert.」
How many dishes they produce depends on the family, though.
[Shigure]: 「Every day is French cuisine, then.」
[Kashou]: 「So, yeah, it's not that rare to see most people eating a cake almost every day.」
[Shigure]: 「Mm-hmm, mm-hmm... I see.」
[Shigure]: 「I still find it rather curious that households partake in full course meals.」
[Kashou]: 「Well, I mean... even for general home cooking in Japan, from other countries' perspective, it looks like a Japanese version of a full course meal.」
[Kashou]: 「Tea, white rice, miso soup, entrees, meat, and fish... There's not much difference between the amount of dishes they use.」
[Shigure]: 「Oh, when you put it that way...!」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “In France, it’s perfectly normal to eat cake when you have a meal.”
[Kashou]: “Even in ordinary families, dinner is—salad, soup, bread, fish dishes, meat dishes, cheese, dessert… like that. How many plates are served depends on each family.”
[Shigure]: “Every day is French cuisine, it sounds like.”
[Kashou]: “That’s why there are people who eat cake almost every day too, and it's not unusual at all.”
[Shigure]: “Hmm… I see….”
[Shigure]: “It feels strangely peculiar. Having a full course meal at home…”
[Kashou]: “No, no… even Japanese everyday family meals would seem like kaiseki cuisine to someone from another country.”
[Kashou]: “Tea, rice, miso soup, side dishes, meat and fish… the number of plates used isn’t that different, is it?”
[Shigure]: “You're right!”

[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
[character] Name: Minaduki Shigure (水無月 時雨) | Gender: Female
Question:
[時雨]: 「あっ、私、水無月時雨と申します」
[時雨]: 「や、約束もないのに、ついてきてしまって……もちろん、ご迷惑はおかけしませんので！」
[ベニエ]: 「時雨……？　じゃあ、嘉祥の妹の……？」
[時雨]: 「は、はい」
[嘉祥]: 「申し訳ありません、師匠……勝手についてきてしまって」
[ベニエ]: 「よく来たわね、時雨……！　ずっと会いたいと思っていたわ」
[時雨]: 「あ……私もです、ベニエさん。兄様ったら、帰国したあと師匠様の話ばかりするものだから」
[ベニエ]: 「あら、そうなの？　嘉祥は、フランスでは妹の話ばかりしていたわ」
[嘉祥]: 「えっ、そ、そんなことはないでしょう……？」
reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「Oh, I am Shigure Minaduki.」
[Shigure]: 「I-I'm here unannounced since I tagged along... but, of course, I will make sure that I am of no inconvenience!」
[Beignet]: 「Shigure...? Then, you're Kashou's little sister...?」
[Shigure]: 「Y-Yes, ma'am.」
[Kashou]: 「My apologies, Mentor... She followed me of her own accord.」
[Beignet]: 「I'm so glad you've come, Shigure...! I've always wanted to meet you!」
[Shigure]: 「Oh... As have I, Beignet-san. Nii-sama couldn't stop talking about his prized mentor after coming back from overseas, after all.」
[Beignet]: 「Oh my, is that so? Kashou couldn't stop talking about his lovely little sister while in France.」
[Kashou]: 「Huh? Th-That isn't true, though...?」
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: “Ah, I’m Minaduki Shigure.”
[Shigure]: “W-Wait! I ended up following you even though there was no agreement… Of course, I won't cause any trouble!”
[Beignet]: “Shigure…? So, you’re Kashou’s younger sister...?”
[Shigure]: “Yes.”
[Kashou]: “I apologize, Master… for just following you without permission.”
[Beignet]: “You came a long way, Shigure...! I've been wanting to meet you for so long.”
[Shigure]: “Ah… me too, Beignet-san. My brother always tells you stories when he returns home.”
[Beignet]: “Oh? Really? Kashou was just talking about you in France.”
[Kashou]: “Eh, really? That’s not true…?!”

Question:
[フレーズ]: 「わかりました……それじゃあ、看板を出すのを手伝ってください。そのあと、窓ガラスを拭きます」
[時雨]: 「はい！」
[ベニエ]: 「私も、準備をしないと」
[嘉祥]: 「俺も手伝います！」
[ベニエ]: 「おやおや、何を言っているのかしら？」
[嘉祥]: 「え？」
[ベニエ]: 「嘉祥の場合は手伝いじゃなく、貴方の役目よ？　２日間だけでも、滞在するからには働いてもらうわ。前と同じように」
[嘉祥]: 「あ……もちろんです！！」
何年も働いていた店だ。物の位置も、段取りも、ほとんど変わっていない。全て覚えている。
俺は戸惑うことなく、開店準備に取りかかった。
ショーケースの中を拭き、ケーキを並べる。
reference_answer:
[Fraise]: 「Very well... In that case, I would appreciate it if you helped me bring out the sandwich sign. Afterward, we'll clean the windows.」
[Shigure]: 「Right!」
[Beignet]: 「I should get things ready myself.」
[Kashou]: 「I'll help you with that!」
[Beignet]: 「Oh my, what are you talking about?」
[Kashou]: 「Huh?」
[Beignet]: 「This isn't going to be 'helping out', this is going to be your 'role'. You're only here for two days, but I'm going to have you work since you're here. Just like before.」
[Kashou]: 「Oh... Of course!」
I worked in this shop for years. The location of items, the preparations—almost nothing has changed. I remember everything.
I get started on preparing for opening without any indecision.
I wipe off the glass showcase and line up the cakes.
ModelAnswer:
[Fraise]: “I understand… then, please help me set up the sign. After that, I’ll clean the window glass.”
[Shigure]: “Yes!”
[Beignet]: “I also have to prepare; otherwise…”
[Kashou]: “I’ll help too!”
[Beignet]: “Oh my, what are you talking about?”
[Kashou]: “Huh?”
[Beignet]: “When it comes to Kashou, it’s not helping, but your role? Since I'm staying for two days, just like before, I expect you to work.”
[Kashou]: “Ah… of course!!”
It’s a shop where I’ve worked for many years. The positions of the items and the arrangements are almost unchanged. I remember everything.
I started on the preparations for opening without hesitation.
I wiped down the interior of the display case and arranged the cakes.

metadata:

[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
[ベニエ]: 「変わり映えがないでしょう」
[嘉祥]: 「とんでもない。俺にとっては、今もこのケーキが完璧で究極の目標です」
[嘉祥]: 「……俺……父親にケーキを食べてもらおうと思ったんです」

[嘉祥]: 「でも、父親は食べるまでもないって」
[ベニエ]: 「…………そう」
[嘉祥]: 「そして、俺の料理には芯がないそうです。軸とか核とか主って意味だと思うんですけど」
自分でも理解していない概念をフランス語で説明するのは難しかった。
[嘉祥]: 「師匠……もう一度、俺に修行させてもらえませんか？」
[ベニエ]: 「私にも、嘉祥のお父さんの言う芯の意味はわかりません」
reference_answer:
[Beignet]: 「Well, nothing much has changed.」
[Kashou]: 「Don't sell yourself short. These cakes are perfect, and they're the ultimate goal for me.」
[Kashou]: 「...I... tried to get dad to eat my cake.」
[Beignet]: 「I see... And how did that go?」
[Kashou]: 「Dad said 'he didn't need to eat it'.」
[Beignet]: 「...I see.」
[Kashou]: 「He also said that my cooking lacks a 'core'. I think he means a 'main part', like an 'axis' or a 'nucleus' in other things.」
It's hard trying to explain a concept I don't comprehend myself into French.
[Kashou]: 「Mentor... Will you allow me to train under you once again?」
[Beignet]: 「I'm not sure what this 'core' your father speaks of is, either.」
ModelAnswer:
[Beignet]: “You wouldn’t think there’s been any change.”
[Kashou]: “Not at all. For me, this cake is still the perfect and ultimate goal.”
[Kashou]: “…I… I wanted to have my father eat a cake.”
[Beignet]: “Yes… how was it?”
[Kashou]: “But Father didn’t even want to eat it.”
[Beignet]: “…………Yes.”
[Kashou]: “And they said my cooking lacks a core. I think you mean ‘axis,’ ‘nucleus,’ or ‘main’ – but I couldn't explain it in French, even to myself.”
[Kashou]: “Mentor… could you please let me train again?”
[Beignet]: “I don’t understand either what Father’s ‘core’ means.”

metadata:
[character] Name: Beignet (ベニエ) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Mentor (師匠)
[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
[嘉祥]: 「そう思います。父親は頑固で口下手だけど……認めたくないからって嘘を言うような人じゃない」
[ベニエ]: 「説明しなかったことに、意味がある。それは理解できているのね？」
[嘉祥]: 「ええ、たぶん」
[ベニエ]: 「なら、私には教えることができない。それも理解できる？」
[嘉祥]: 「はい……」
おそらく、俺には足りないものがある。
そして、父親と師匠は理解している。
しかし、言葉で説明できるようなものではない。
[嘉祥]: 「ううぅ……」
悩んでしまい、また思考がぐるぐると頭の中を回った。
[ベニエ]: 「私は役に立たないと言ったでしょう？　今のうちに国へ帰る？」
[嘉祥]: 「あ、いや！　何かを見つけなければ、帰れません」
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「That's what I think, too. Dad is hardheaded and terrible with words, but... he's not the kind of person to lie just because he doesn't approve of something.」
[Beignet]: 「There is some meaning behind him not explaining himself. You realize that, at least?」
[Kashou]: 「Yes, somewhat.」
[Beignet]: 「Then, I can't teach you anything. You realize that as well?」
[Kashou]: 「Yes...」
I'm guess there's something I'm missing.
Something dad and Mentor both understand.
However, it's not something that can be explained in words.
[Kashou]: 「Unghh...」
I find myself lost with my thoughts running around in circles in my head.
[Beignet]: 「I told you that I wouldn't do you any good, didn't I? Why not get back to Japan while you still can?」
[Kashou]: 「Oh, no! I cannot go back until I find something—anything.」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “I agree. My father is stubborn and has a difficult way with words, but… he wouldn’t lie just because he doesn’t want to acknowledge it.”
[Beignet]: “There’s meaning in what wasn't explained. You understand that, don’t you?”
[Kashou]: “Yes, probably.”
[Beignet]: “Then there’s nothing I can teach you. Do you understand that too?”
[Kashou]: “Yes….”
I suspect I lack something essential.
And my father and teacher understand.
But it's not something that can be explained in words.
[Kashou]: “Uuuh…”
I was lost in thought, and my mind spun around again.
[Beignet]: “I said I’m useless, didn’t I? Shall we return to the country for now?”
[Kashou]: “Ah, no! I can’t go back until I find something.”

Question:

[ベニエ]: 「一人の志ある者は川を渡れるけれど、皆に志を抱かせる者は、川に橋を作れるもの」
[嘉祥]: 「たしかに時雨は、橋を作らせるタイプかな」
[時雨]: 「兄様、一緒に映りましょう」

[時雨]: 「お客さまにフィアンセですかって訊かれちゃいました♪」

reference_answer:
[Fraise]: 「L-Like this...?」
[Beignet]: 「Hehe... Fraise always gives you the runaround when it comes to stuff like that, but it seems like Shigure has the power to make people take action.」
[Kashou]: 「No, she is just pushy.」
[Beignet]: 「Being pushy isn't all that bad, depending on the situation. If that's all she was,  people wouldn't take action. Being able to motivate people is a valuable quality.」
[Beignet]: 「A single motivated person can cross a river, but a person who motivates many can build a bridge.」
[Kashou]: 「Yeah, maybe Shigure is the type to help build bridges.」
[Shigure]: 「Nii-sama, come join the photo.」
[Kashou]: 「Huh?! Me, too...?!」
[Shigure]: 「Our customer asked if you were my fiancé♪」
[Kashou]: 「You didn't feed her a lie, did you?」
ModelAnswer:
[Fraise]: “C-could it be like this…??”
[Beignet]: “Hehe… Phrase used to run away from things like this. Shigure has the power to inspire people to act, you know.”
[Kashou]: “It’s just forceful.”
[Beignet]: “Forcefulness can be a good thing too, if you say it at the right time and in the right circumstances. Simply forcing someone won't make them move. Inspiring their will is a very important quality.”
[Beignet]: “One person with a strong resolve can cross a river, but one who inspires many to have that resolve builds a bridge across it.”
[Kashou]: “True, Shigure seems to be the type to build bridges.”
[Shigure]: “Let’s take a picture together.”
[Kashou]: “Huh?! Me too…!”
[Shigure]: “Someone asked me if I was fiancée♪”
[Kashou]: “No way! You weren't lying?”

Well, the French do have more intimate family relationships in comparison to the Japanese.

They're all probably here for Shigure.

Question:

reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「...Huh?」
[Beignet]: 「I think it'd be best for you to look at what the world has to offer, as well. In person and not through a small screen.」
[Shigure]: 「You must forgive me... I cannot live in a world without Nii-sama.」
[Shigure]: 「I need three things: water, air, and Nii-sama.」
[Beignet]: 「Is that so? What a shame.」
[Shigure]: 「Phew... As expected of Nii-sama's mentor... Beignet-san makes better arguments.」
[Kashou]: 「I'm not sure how much of that was true, but... I also agree that Fraise should learn more about the world.」
[Kashou]: 「But, it doesn't have to be right away. Whenever the time comes where you want to do that, I'll do everything in my power to help you, Fraise.」
[Fraise]: 「...Thank you very much. When that time does come, I would appreciate it.」
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: “…………Huh?”
[Beignet]: “I think you should open your eyes to a variety of things, not just through small screens.”
[Shigure]: “I’m sorry… I can't live in a world without my brother.”
[Shigure]: “I need water, air, and my brother.”
[Beignet]: “Really? That’s a shame.”
[Shigure]: “Fuu…… Truly impressive, Master’s mentor… Beignet-san is better than me.”
[Kashou]: “The mentor doesn't know how serious he is, but... I agree with Fraise wanting to learn about the wider world.”

[Fraise]: “……Thank you. When that time comes, I definitely will.”

The original La Soleil is fermée— closed for business—before sunset.

The main branch, La Soleil, closes for business before sunset – fermé.

[All]: “Itadakimasu, itadakimasu.”

[Kashou]: 「But, as I worked through the day, I kind of started to remember the old days.」
[Kashou]: 「My desire from when I first started off to make Western sweets had resuscitated.」
ModelAnswer:
That cake was a new flavor, and the first time I’d ever tasted it, but it was undeniably Master’s taste…
It felt both fresh and nostalgic.
[Kashou]: “...I feel like I came to this town just to eat this.”
[Beignet]: “Are you a little calmer?”
[Kashou]: “I don't know, but... did I disappoint you that much?”
[Beignet]: “You were making a lost kitten’s face.”
[Kashou]: "How embarrassing."
[Kashou]: "Honestly, when I was helping out in the shop, there were times I wondered if I should even be doing this.”
[Kashou]: “I need to make a cake that will convince my father by Christmas—that’s it.”
[Kashou]: “But as I've been working, I guess I remembered how I felt back then.”
[Kashou]: "The initial feeling of wanting to make pastries came back."

Question:
[ベニエ]: 「……私は、嘉祥のお父さんではないから、わからないわね。そうかもしれないし、違うのかもしれない」
[ベニエ]: 「言葉というのは、言った本人にすら、本当の意味がわからないこともある」
[ベニエ]: 「１００人が受け取れば、１００通りの解釈があるのが、言葉というものだから」
[ベニエ]: 「大切なのは言葉ではなくて……」
[ベニエ]: 「いえ……少し話しすぎたわね」
[ベニエ]: 「長旅のうえに、ずっと働いて疲れたでしょう。シャワーを浴びて、早めに寝るといいわ」
[ベニエ]: 「あ……うっかりしていたわ。空き部屋はあるけれど、ベッドは嘉祥が使っていたものしか空いてないの」
[ベニエ]: 「一緒に使ってもらってもいいかしら？」
reference_answer:
[Beignet]: 「...I'm not your father, so I don't know. Your hunch could be right, or you it could be wrong.」
[Beignet]: 「There's also a chance that not even he himself knows the true meaning behind what he said.」
[Beignet]: 「Words are like that. You give them to a hundred different people, and they'll interpret them a hundred different ways.」
[Beignet]: 「What's important isn't the words. It's...」
[Beignet]: 「No... I've said too much.」
[Beignet]: 「The day's work on top of the long trip must have you tired, no? You should shower up and hurry to bed.」
[Beignet]: 「Oh... How silly of me to forget. There are empty rooms here, but the only one with a free bed is the one that Kashou used before.」
[Beignet]: 「Would the two of you mind sharing?」
ModelAnswer:
[Beignet]: “...I’m not Kashou’s father, so I don't know. It might be true, or it might not.”
[Beignet]: “Words are things that even the person who speaks them themselves may not truly understand.”
[Beignet]: “That’s because one hundred people can interpret a single word in one hundred different ways.”
[Beignet]: “What's important isn’t the words themselves… ”
[Beignet]: “No... I talked too much.”
[Beignet]: “After such a long journey and working so hard, you must be tired. Take a shower and go to bed early.”
[Beignet]: “Ah… I forgot. There is an empty room, but only Kashou’s bed is available.”
[Beignet]: “Would it be alright if you used it together?”

Question:

reference_answer:

[Shigure]: 「...Huh?!」
[Kashou]: 「But if you don't want to, that's a different story.」

[Shigure]: 「Urk... I am in such bliss... I think I might pass out.」
[Beignet]: 「...You're sure you'll be all right, Kashou?」
[Kashou]: 「Shigure just gets like this sometimes. I'm positive we'll be just fine. Please, believe me, Mentor.」
[Beignet]: 「Tee hee hee... One less worry, then.」
[Beignet]: 「I see... So, this is the type of girl Shigure is. I'm glad I've gotten to meet her.」
ModelAnswer:

[Shigure]: “Ugh……I’m so happy I feel like I might faint!”

Question:
[時雨]: 「きっと頻繁に手を入れているのでしょうね。部屋は使わなければ、悪くなるものですから」
[嘉祥]: 「言われてみれば……」
[時雨]: 「毎日のように窓を開けたり、埃を払わないと、すぐカビ臭くなります」
[嘉祥]: 「そういうものか？」
[時雨]: 「実家にある兄様の部屋は、私が毎日のように手入れしていますから万全です」
[時雨]: 「窓を開けて、空気を入れ換えて、机を乾拭きし、ベッドの寝心地を確かめています」
[嘉祥]: 「そ、そうか」
ベッドの寝心地は、毎日チェックする必要が……？
[時雨]: 「たぶんベニエさんは、また兄様が来るのをずっと待っていたのだと思います」
[嘉祥]: 「そうか……」
reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「I am to assume that she frequently tidies it up. Rooms are meant to be used, after all.」
[Kashou]: 「Now that you mention it...」
[Shigure]: 「Unless you open the windows and dust almost daily, the smell of mildew will instantly grow.」
[Kashou]: 「Is that how it works?」
[Shigure]: 「I tidy up your room back at home almost every day, so it is spotless.」
[Shigure]: 「I open the windows, air out the inside, wipe down your desk, and check the comfort levels of your bed.」
[Kashou]: 「O-Oh, I see.」
Is there a need for a daily check of my bed's comfort levels...?
[Shigure]: 「It might be that Beignet-san had been waiting for your return this entire time, Nii-sama.」
[Kashou]: 「Huh. Maybe...」
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: “It must be constantly interfering, doesn’t it? Rooms become dilapidated if they aren't used. ”
[Kashou]: “You know, you might be right…”
[Shigure]: “Every day I open the windows and clean up dust, or the place quickly becomes moldy.”
[Kashou]: “I see.”
[Shigure]: “My brother’s room at home is always kept in perfect condition because I take care of it daily.”
[Shigure]: “I open the windows to ventilate the air, wipe down the desk with a dry cloth, and check the comfort of the bed.”
[Kashou]: “So… you have to check the bed’s comfort every day?”
[Shigure]: “Perhaps Beignet has been waiting for his brother to return all this time.”
[Kashou]: “I see…”

Question:

reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Tomorrow's another early day. Let's shower up and get to bed.」
[Shigure]: 「Huh? We're showering together?! W-Well... m-my body and mind... are ready.」
[Kashou]: 「Of course not together. Hurry and take yours first.」
[Shigure]: 「Right away!」
[Shigure]: 「Nya~oh♪ Nyaoh? Nya-ohm.」
[Kashou]: 「Shigure, you're sick. You need a hospital ASAP.」
[Shigure]: 「My apologies. I am just so thrilled that I forgot human speech for a second.」
[Kashou]: 「Well, you did work hard today.」
[Shigure]: 「You are too kind. Especially considering I tagged along of my own accord.」
[Kashou]: 「Don't sweat it. I came here of my own accord too, so we're in the same boat.」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “Tomorrow’s coming so soon. Let's take a shower and go to sleep.”
[Shigure]: “Really? Together in the shower!? It… it’s… I’m mentally prepared.”
[Kashou]: “You wouldn’t say that. Hurry up and take a shower.”
[Shigure]: “Okay.”
[Shigure]: “Nya~o♪ Nyao? Nyaan.”
[Kashou]: “Shigure is sick, let's go to the hospital right away.”
[Shigure]: “I’m sorry. I was so happy that I forgot how to speak human language.”
[Kashou]: “Well… you worked hard today.”
[Shigure]: “That’s too kind. I just followed you around without a care.”
[Kashou]: “It’s alright…. I came here on my own, too.”

[Kashou]: “What’s wrong, Shigure!? Did you catch a cold!?”
[Shigure]: “I… I’m fine… I… just felt overwhelmed by Onii-sama…”
[Kashou]: “I didn’t do anything, I think… aren't you doing anything?”
[Shigure]: “...Yes… I haven't touched anyone with a single finger.”
[Kashou]: “Let’s take a shower for now? You’re covered in sweat. The sheets are soaking wet.”
[Shigure]: “I’m glad it was just sweat… I almost turned someone’s bed into a splatter film prop!”
[Kashou]: “Nosebleed…?”

Shigure stood up, straightened her rumpled pajamas, and limped towards the shower room.

Question:

申し訳ないような、情けないような。もちろん、感謝の気持ちが一番大きいが。
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「I've been in this line of work for much longer, but you're way more diligent than I'll ever be.」
[Fraise]: 「You put painstaking detail into your work. I'd like to learn by your example.」
[Kashou]: 「Really?」
[Fraise]: 「Granted, I oftentimes see you space out...」
[Kashou]: 「Urk...」
[Fraise]: 「You have a lot of things on your mind that you need to sort out at the moment, right, Kashou-san?」
[Fraise]: 「Pâtissière told me some of the details.」
[Kashou]: 「Yeah, but that's still no reason to space out in the middle of work.」
[Fraise]: 「I will work to pick up the slack.」
[Kashou]: 「I'm not sure what I should say...」
I feel somewhere between apologetic and pathetic. Of course, I'm more grateful than anything, but that goes without saying.
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “I was the one who worked longer, but Fraise is performing better than me.”
[Fraise]: “Master is so meticulous and considerate. I want to learn from you.”
[Kashou]: “Really?”
[Fraise]: “Sometimes I zone out… but…”
[Kashou]: “Ugh……”
[Fraise]: “The current Master is troubled, and there’s a lot he needs to think about… ”
[Fraise]: “I heard a little something from Fraise, the pastry chef.”
[Kashou]: “There's no excuse for daydreaming during work, though.”
[Fraise]: “That’s something I’ll take care of.”
[Kashou]: “What should I say… ”
I’m sorry, I feel pathetic. Of course, gratitude is the biggest thing.”

[Fraise]: 「I just remember; that's all.」

[Kashou]: 「Also, I appreciate you helping out Mentor in such big ways as well.」

[Kashou]: “I remember deciding on a name for the kitten when he was three months old… so it must be coming from there…”

[Kashou]: “Ah, of course. Thank you for remembering, Fraize.”
[Kashou]: “And also, thank you to your mentor. I appreciate you helping out so much.”

reference_answer:

[Kashou]: 「Ooh, we've got even more customers than we did yesterday. It's looking a lot like Christmas over here.」
[Shigure]: 「This shop has always been a popular spot among those in the know, but the social media presence seems to have sparked a bigger flame.」
[Kashou]: 「Don't talk like you didn't start it.」
[Shigure]: 「My apologies. I never thought that it would prove this effective.」
[Fraise]: 「Shigure-san... I think you may have overdid it.」
[Shigure]: 「What are you even saying, Fraise? I am not the only cause here.」
[Shigure]: 「You have become the hot topic yourself. Look! Right here, see?」
Shigure holds out her cellphone to reveal a line of comments praising Fraise.
There are even some customers stating they're explicitly coming to see her. Most likely standing in that line outside the shop...
ModelAnswer:
[Fraise]: “It’s terrible, Older Brother! There's a huge line outside...!”
[Kashou]: “Oh… it’s much bigger than yesterday. A truly incredible number of customers. It’s like Christmas.”
[Shigure]: “It was already a well-known place, but SNS seems to have really ignited the interest.”
[Kashou]: “Don't talk about me like that.”
[Shigure]: “I’m sorry. I didn’t expect such an effect.”
[Fraise]: “Shigure… you’re going a bit too far.”
[Shigure]: “What are you saying, Fraise? It’s not just because of me!”
[Shigure]: “You're also incredibly popular. Look! There, look!”
The smartphone Shigure thrust forward showed words praising Fraize. People who have declared they’re going to visit are numerous. Probably within the line that’s formed in front of the store…

Just like last night, we have a spectacular dinner.

metadata:

Question:
[時雨]: 「間違いありません。話題になったことで大勢が情報を調べ、名店という評価が多かったからこそ。相乗効果です」
[嘉祥]: 「俺としては、師匠の素晴らしいケーキをより多くの人が知ってくれたから、嬉しいけど」
[フレーズ]: 「ううぅ……明日もこの調子だと、ちょっと大変かもしれません」
[ベニエ]: 「今日が特別だったのよ、きっと」
[ベニエ]: 「今日みたいな行列は、明日はないと思うわ」
[フレーズ]: 「そうですよね……明日は、またパティシエールとわたしだけになりますから」
俺たちは、今夜には発つ予定だった。フランスと日本の時差は７時間。約束の３日間で帰宅するには、そのくらいの時間に出なくては。
結局、俺は自分に足りないものが、まだわからないでいた。
気持ち的には、だいぶ楽になったのだが……
reference_answer:
[Shigure]: 「That is absolutely right. The shop becoming a hot topic led to a majority of people looking into information, which led to a lot of rave reviews. It's synergy.」
[Kashou]: 「Personally, I'm glad that a lot of people know about your incredible cakes, Mentor.」
[Fraise]: 「Unghhh... If tomorrow is like it was today, then we might have more than a little problem.」
[Beignet]: 「I'm sure that today was just a special case.」
[Beignet]: 「I don't think we'll have lines out the door again tomorrow.」
[Fraise]: 「Right... Tomorrow will just be Pâtissière and me.」
We both have plans to depart tonight. There's a seven hour time difference between France and Japan, so we need to leave by then in order to make it back home when I promised.
In the end, I still don't know what it is I'm missing.
I feel a lot better mentally, though...
ModelAnswer:
[Shigure]: “It’s absolutely true. A large number of people have been researching the topic, and it received a reputation as a top-tier shop. It's a synergistic effect.”
[Kashou]: “I’m happy that more people now know about my mentor’s wonderful cake.”
[Fraise]: “Uuuh… If things continue like this tomorrow, it might be a little difficult.”
[Beignet]: “Today was truly special, I just know it.”
[Beignet]: “We won't have lines like today anytime soon.”
[Fraise]: “That’s true… Tomorrow, it will just be me and the pastry chef.”
We were scheduled to leave tonight. The time difference between France and Japan is seven hours. To return within our promised three days, we needed to depart at that time.
Ultimately, I still didn't understand what was missing from myself.
I felt much better emotionally… but…

Question:
[嘉祥]: 「あ、すみません……」
[ベニエ]: 「結局、お役に立てなかったわね」
[嘉祥]: 「いや、そんなことは！」
[嘉祥]: 「あ……まぁ……まだ、父親の言う芯ってのは、よくわかっていません」
[嘉祥]: 「でも、この場所へ来て、お店を手伝って、思い出しました」
[嘉祥]: 「俺は、やっぱり、皆を笑顔にするケーキが作りたい」
[嘉祥]: 「師匠の作るケーキは、本当に美味しくて、優しい味で……皆を笑顔にしてくれるんです」
[ベニエ]: 「……ありがとう。そう言ってもらえて、嬉しいわ」
[嘉祥]: 「俺は、なんだか、いろいろと考えすぎて……最初の気持ちを忘れていたというか……」
[嘉祥]: 「口では目指していると言いつつ、別のことに捕らわれていたように思います」
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Oh, my apologies...」
[Beignet]: 「Looks like I wasn't able to help after all.」
[Kashou]: 「No, that's not true!」
[Kashou]: 「Eh. Well... I'm just still lost on what my father meant by a 'core'.」
[Kashou]: 「But after coming here and helping in the shop, I remembered something.」
[Kashou]: 「I really do want to make cakes that bring smiles to everyone's faces.」
[Kashou]: 「Mentor, your cakes are so good and have such a gentle flavor... that they bring smiles to people's faces.」
[Beignet]: 「...Thank you. It warms my heart to hear you say that.」
[Kashou]: 「It's sort of like I've been thinking of so much... I've lost sight of my initial focus...」
[Kashou]: 「I may have said that was my goal, but I was trapped by something else.」
ModelAnswer:
[Kashou]: “Ah, I’m sorry…”
[Beignet]: “You couldn’t be of any help after all.”
[Kashou]: “No, that’s not true!”
[Kashou]: “Ah… well… I still don't really understand what my father meant by ‘core’.”
[Kashou]: “But coming here, helping with the shop, it made me remember something.”
[Kashou]: “I want to make cakes that will make everyone smile, after all.”
[Kashou]: “The Master’s cakes are truly delicious and have such a gentle flavor… they bring people joy.”
[Beignet]: “...Thank you. I'm happy to hear you say that.”
[Kashou]: “I seem to have been overthinking things, getting caught up in something else instead of remembering my initial feelings…”

[嘉祥]: 「ありがとうございます」

[ベニエ]: 「……そうね」

[ベニエ]: 「ふふ……そうだったかしら？」
[嘉祥]: 「それなら、パティシエールになった理由は、どうなんでしょうか？」
[ベニエ]: 「……この店は……私の祖母の代からのもので、ずっとケーキを作ってきたの」
[ベニエ]: 「嘉祥の家ほどではないけれど、守るべき伝統があると思っているわ」
reference_answer:
[Beignet]: 「Just as I've said before, I don't know what your father meant, but I support you, regardless.」
[Kashou]: 「Thank you very much.」
[Kashou]: 「Speaking of which, I've talked about my reasons for cake-making plenty of times, but... you've never talked about yours, have you, Mentor?」
[Beignet]: 「...That's right.」
[Kashou]: 「Well, when I asked you in the past, I remember you answered, 'I make cakes because I'm a pâtissière', but...」
[Beignet]: 「Hehe... Did I now?」
[Kashou]: 「In that case, what about your reasons for being a pâtissière in the first place?」
[Beignet]: 「...This pâtissièrie... has been making cakes since my grandmother's generation.」
[Beignet]: 「And while not to the extent of your family, I do think that it has a tradition that needs to be protected.」
ModelAnswer:
[Beignet]: “As I’ve said before, I don't know the true intentions of your father, but I am supporting you.”
[Kashou]: “Thank you.”
[Kashou]: “Speaking of which, I’ve told you many times why I make cakes… but you haven’t heard about my mentor?”
[Beignet]: “...Yes, I suppose.”
[Kashou]: “No, the last time I heard, I was told I made cakes because I'm a pastry chef… ”
[Beignet]: “Hehe… do you remember that?”
[Kashou]: “Then, what’s the reason for becoming a pastry chef?”
[Beignet]: “...This shop is... it’s been passed down from my grandmother and we’ve been making cakes ever since.”
[Beignet]: "Not as much as your household, but I believe there are traditions to uphold."
